description: Commands to manage life cycle of deployments of an app in Azure Spring Cloud. More operations on deployments can be done on app level with parameter --deployment. e.g. az spring-cloud app deploy --deployment <staging deployment>.

commands.name: az spring-cloud app deployment create
commands.summary: Create a staging deployment for the app. To deploy code or update setting to an existing deployment, use `az spring-cloud app deploy/update --deployment <staging deployment>`.
commands.syntax:
az spring-cloud app deployment create --app
                                      --name
                                      --resource-group
                                      --service
                                      [--artifact-path]
                                      [--build-env]
                                      [--builder]
                                      [--config-file-patterns]
                                      [--container-args]
                                      [--container-command]
                                      [--container-image]
                                      [--container-registry]
                                      [--cpu]
                                      [--disable-probe {false, true}]
                                      [--disable-validation {false, true}]
                                      [--env]
                                      [--instance-count]
                                      [--jvm-options]
                                      [--main-entry]
                                      [--memory]
                                      [--no-wait]
                                      [--registry-password]
                                      [--registry-username]
                                      [--runtime-version {Java_11, Java_17, Java_8, NetCore_31}]
                                      [--skip-clone-settings]
                                      [--source-path]
                                      [--target-module]
                                      [--version]
examples: az spring-cloud app deployment create -n green-deployment --app MyApp -s MyCluster -g MyResourceGroup
az spring-cloud app deployment create -n green-deployment --app MyApp -s MyCluster -g MyResourceGroup --jar-path app.jar --jvm-options="-XX:+UseG1GC -XX:+UseStringDeduplication" --env foo=bar
az spring-cloud app deployment create -n green-deployment --app MyApp -s MyCluster -g MyResourceGroup --container-image contoso/your-app:v1

az spring-cloud app deployment create -n green-deployment --app MyApp -s MyCluster -g MyResourceGroup --container-image contoso/your-app:v1 --container-registry myacr.azurecr.io --registry-username <username> --registry-password <password>

commands.name: az spring-cloud app deployment delete
commands.summary: Delete a deployment of the app.

commands.name: az spring-cloud app deployment generate-heap-dump
commands.summary: Generate a heap dump of your target app instance to given file path.

commands.name: az spring-cloud app deployment generate-thread-dump
commands.summary: Generate a thread dump of your target app instance to given file path.

commands.name: az spring-cloud app deployment list
commands.summary: List all deployments in an app.

commands.name: az spring-cloud app deployment start-jfr
commands.summary: Start a JFR on your target app instance to given file path.
